author: Simon Thiel
title: Beacon Roofing Agrees to Buy Roofing Supply for $1.1 Billion
text:
Beacon Roofing Supply Inc., an U.S. supplier of building materials, agreed to buy Roofing Supply Group for $1.1 billion from buyout firm Clayton, Dubilier & Rice to expand its offerings in California, Florida and Texas.
Beacon will pay $286 million in cash and give Roofing Supply’s shareholders $291 million of its common stock, the company said in a statement Monday. Beacon will also refinance about $565 million of Roofing Supply’s debt, it said.
“Roofing Supply complements Beacon geographically, especially in the southern and western United States,” said Beacon Chairman Robert Buck. “This is a momentous event for these two great companies and for the future of the roofing distribution industry.”
Beacon is one of the largest distributors of residential and non-residential roofing and complementary building products in North America. As a result of the acquisition, Beacon will have about $3.7 billion in annual revenues and 356 branches.
